VulnerabilityDesc.Location: permitAndMulticall() function in PermitAndMulticall.sol and TWABDelegator.sol contracts
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: An attacker may use the permitAndMulticall() function to steal funds or as a Denial of Service (DoS) attack if the _from address is not the message sender. If an attacker calls permitAndMulticall() before the _from user, they may use their signature and nonce combination, which could result in a DoS attack by continually front-running permitAndCall() using other users' signatures. The severity of the vulnerability was initially disputed, but it was ultimately labeled as a Medium Risk (2) vulnerability because funds are not directly at risk, but the attacker would enjoy better odds of winning.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Update the _from field to be the msg.sender in permitAndMulticall() or alternatively do this in _permitAndMulticall() to save some gas.
